SENT.plain: In 262 patients with thyrotoxicosis and atrial fibrillation there were 26 episodes of arterial embolism (17 cerebral and nine elsewhere) in 21 patients
Twelve incidents occurred with active thyrotoxicosis, three on reversion to sinus rhythm, and 11 after the patients were euthyroid
This important complication is more common than is realised, and most patients should be put on prophylactic anticoagulants when first seen with atrial fibrillation
